These are recipes to common tasks like retrieving data from <a href="https://www.nomisweb.co.uk/" target="_blank">Nomis</a>, geocoding addresses, and creating data visualisations like population pyramids. All the <a href="https://cran.r-project.org/" target="_blank">R</a> code is provided along with step by step instructions. For those wanting an introductory guide to R check out <a href="https://r4ds.had.co.nz/" target="_blank">R for Data Science</a>.

<h4>Want to contribute?</h4>
These recipes have been created using the <a href="https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/" target="_blank">rmarkdown</a> R package which makes editing easy. Any GitHub user (<a href="https://github.com/" target="_blank">sign-up at github.com</a>) can make changes to a recipe by clicking <img src="edit_button.png" alt="Edit button" style="width:6em;">. Once you've made your edits you can submit your changes for approval. If you'd rather just make a comment you can post an <a href="https://github.com/trafforddatalab/recipes/issues" target="_blank">issue</a> on GitHub. 

New recipes are also very welcome. A recipe template is available to download from <a href="https://github.com/traffordDataLab/recipes/raw/master/template.Rmd" target="_blank">here</a>. When you've completed your recipe send us a <a href="https://help.github.com/en/articles/about-pull-requests" target="_blank">pull request</a>.
